creator: jmason900@yahoo.com
text:
I can't locate any documentation for the MINOR codes that are reported by 
Tomcat on failures....  The major codes are standard HTTP codes.  The minor 4 
digit codes are probably much more valuable for debugging specific problems BUT 
there is no documentation....

Do we have to randomly scan ALL open source looking for the minor status 
codes????

eg status code = 500 6787...

Where is 6787 documented???

Thanks..

Jim Mason

creator: funkman@joedog.org
text:
Can you be more specific as to where the 6787 is originating? 

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec6.html states the status line to be:

Status-Line = HTTP-Version SP Status-Code SP Reason-Phrase CRLF

There is no such thing as a "minor 4 digit codes".

Closing for now unless more clarification is given.

Here's a sample of the undocumented reason codes that show up in an Apache 
access log for Tomcat:

127.0.0.1 - - [19/Feb/2003:12:58:35 -0500] "GET /zpar1v4/WFLogon?inv=cl718560 
HTTP/1.1" 200 88
127.0.0.1 - - [19/Feb/2003:12:58:36 -0500] "GET /zpar1v4/styles/error.jsp 
HTTP/1.1" 200 8950
127.0.0.1 - - [19/Feb/2003:14:57:12 -0500] "GET /cts2sample1/logon.jsp 
HTTP/1.1" 500 6701

So where IS the table of server error (500) reason codes to be found?  I've 
been scanning properties files and haven't found them...  I know documentation 
is an extra cost but it shouldn't boil down to this much work to get the reason 
codes..

TIA

Jim Mason
creator: jmason900@yahoo.com
ronald-mailinglist@base.nl
text:
The number you are talking about is not a status code. It's the size of the
response sent to the client/browser.
